recipes.title: Veggie Stew
recipes.methods:
Heat the olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add the chopped onion and garlic and sauté for a few minutes until they become fragrant and translucent.
Add the carrots, potatoes, celery, and bell pepper to the pot. Sauté for another 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally until the vegetables start to soften.
Stir in the zucchini and green beans. Continue to cook for an additional 2-3 minutes.
Pour in the diced tomatoes (with their juice) and add the dried thyme and rosemary. Stir to combine.

recipes.title: Beef Stew
recipes.methods:
In a large pot, heat some oil over medium-high heat.
Add the beef and brown it on all sides. Remove from the pot and set aside.
Add onions and carrots to the pot, cooking until they soften.
Return the beef to the pot, add potatoes, and pour in the beef broth.
Simmer for about 2 hours or until the beef is tender. Season to taste.

recipes.title: Chicken Stew
recipes.methods:
Heat some oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add chicken thighs and brown them. Remove from the pot and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté onions and carrots until they soften.
Return the chicken to the pot, add potatoes, and pour in the chicken broth.
Simmer for about 30-40 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Season to taste.

recipes.title: Vegetable Stew
recipes.methods:
Heat some oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Sauté onions, carrots, and potatoes until they begin to soften.
Add zucchini and red bell pepper and continue to cook for a few minutes.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer for about 20-30 minutes until vegetables are tender. Season to taste.

recipes.title: Lentil Stew
recipes.methods:
In a large pot, sauté onions, carrots, and celery until they soften.
Add lentils and vegetable broth, then simmer for about 30-40 minutes until lentils are tender. Season to taste.
